report_title: Industry Report on Blow Dry Bars
executive_summary: Rising popularity and a consistent push for less expensive hair styling services have bolstered blow dry bars' performance over the past five years. The industry's appeal to a wide array of customers, which spans different age groups but is primarily geared toward female customers, has continued its steady pace of growth. Although operators endured significant revenue decline in 2020 due to the effects of COVID-19, the rapid recovery and pent-up demand following the pandemic provided a robust and quick recovery.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Volatile Economic Conditions Were Impactful, But Sharp Recovery Benefits Operators
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite sharp volatility amid COVID-19, the pent-up demand from consumers during the pandemic enhanced operators' recovery, while also bolstering product diversification among operators. Even as blow dry bar services took a hit, the consistent sales of merchandise helped operators make a quick recovery, while an improving fiscal situation among consumers further enhanced demand that was already heightened due to pandemic-induced social distancing measures.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consistent Popularity Among a Wide Range of Consumers Enhances Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Blow dry bars continue to maintain a consistent growth rate over the past five years, as steady demand from a wide-range of customers of all ages has enhanced the industry's popularity. Since blow dry bars were established with the goal of providing less expensive and more innovative hair styling services compared with traditional hair salons, consumers have taken advantage, particularly young adults with lower fiscal flexibility.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Economic Growth Will Provide Newfound Consumer Demand Moving Forward
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As economic conditions stabilized following COVID-19, and as consumers' fiscal flexibility slowly recovers following heightened inflation, blow dry bar shops will look to take advantage of favorable economic conditions. Anticipated growth in the Consumer Confidence Index, coupled with steadily rising disposable income, highlights strong economic fundamentals and will provide consumers with extra incentives to procure operators' services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Proliferation of Social Media and New Technology Will Bolster Operators' Domestic Exposure
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The continued growth in social media and overall technology will provide operators with new opportunities to enhance their product line's efficiency, while also maximizing their services' exposure to a wider, younger audience. To enhance blow dry bar visibility, operators may look at advertising their business or an individual service, such as blowouts, via social media mediums such as Instagram or Facebook.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry offer hair drying services using a blow dryer and other styling equipment. These bars do not offer haircuts or colors; hair salons are not included in this industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers in this age bracket make up the largest revenue driver for operators, as they have the strongest fiscal flexibility and a consistent need for blow dry bar services, particularly middle-aged women.

One of the largest revenue drivers for operators, consumers in this age bracket have enjoyed newfound demand amid rebounding disposable income and higher exposure to operators' services via social media.
Older consumers are primarily involved in maintaining their hairstyle and look for less expensive options, as they have fixed incomes and don't have the fiscal flexibility of middle-aged adults.

Young customers are considered the smallest revenue generator for operators, as their limited financial flexibility and lower levels of disposable income makes it difficult for them to pursue operators' services on a consistent basis.

products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from sales of blowout services, which are blow dry services used to change a person's hair texture via washing, drying and blow dry tool usage from the servicer.
This product segment generates revenue from sales of updo services, which involve arranging a woman's hair in an upward, or upstyle, position.
This product segment generates revenue via merchandise sales, which often involve hair-related products or gear sold to customers.
This product segment generates revenue via sales of dry styling services, which involve creating different hairstyles for a consumer's hair.

This product segment generates revenue via sales of add-on services. Most add-on services focus on serving clients with additional treatment and care options beyond the traditional blow dry experience, with some examples including hair masks and scalp scrubs.

basis_points.basis_title: High emphasis on staff enhances labor intensity
basis_points.basis_description: The consistent need for staff to provide blow dry bar services highlights the constant labor barriers faced by a variety of operators.

basis_points.basis_title: Prioritization of consumer demand influences buyer power
basis_points.basis_description: Since blow dry shops are involved in direct-to-consumer services, the level of consumer demand plays an influential role in overall buyer power.

basis_points.basis_title: Diversified product lines limit expansion opportunities
basis_points.basis_description: As operators specialize in a mixture of blow dry bar services, it provides niche opportunities to smaller operators in the industry.

basis_points.basis_title: Proliferation of at-home hair services eats into demand
basis_points.basis_description: With more consumers looking to save money on more expensive blow dry services, at-home care provides a less expensive and more convenient alternative.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Continued Necessity for Qualified Staff Heightens Wages
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs continue to make up the largest expenditure for operators, as blow dry bar shops require qualified, licensed workers that can provide quality blow dry bar services for operators' customers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The consistent necessity for blow dry bar shop maintenance exacerbates administrative costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: A variety of alternative costs endured by operators include administrative expenses, maintenance costs associated with the blow dry bar facility and insurance costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Rapid Expansion of Blow Dry Services Enhances
volatility_points.volatility_description: Even as operators faced significant revenue volatility amid economic instability during COVID-19, the proliferation of blow dry services across different age groups has helped heighten the services' popularity.
